DOC.brief_summary: Partial cuff inflation before insertion is generally used for laryngeal mask airway insertion in adult patients. However, it is not proven how much the cuff should be inflated. The aim of this study is to compare efficacy between the method using the resting volume and the method using half the maximum volume for partial cuff inflation.
DOC.brief_title: The Comparison of Two Different Methods of Partial Inflation of Cuff for Facile Insertion of Laryngeal Mask Airway in Adult Patients
DOC.criteria: adult patients (2070 years of age) scheduled for elective surgery undergoing general anesthesia using LMAclassic size 35 patients with an abnormal airway, patients with reactive airway disease, patients with gastroesophageal reflux disease, patients with chronic respiratory disease, or a history of an upper respiratory tract infection
